EngLawName: Fee-charging Standards for census/survey data processing, site and facility usage provided by DGBAS, Executive Yuan
LawName: 行政院主計總處提供普（抽）查資料處理及場地設備使用收費標準
EngLawHistories:
1. Full text Promulgated on January 13, 2005 by the DGBAS, Executive Yuan Order Chu Ren Tsu No.0940000178A.
2. Amended & Promulgated on January 22, 2009 by the DGBAS, Executive Yuan Order Chu Ren Jiu Tsu No.0980000407A.
3. Amended & Promulgated on May 30, 2012 by the DGBAS, Executive Yuan Order Jiu Tong Fu Tsu No.1010300330A.
4. Amended & Promulgated on April 14, 2012 by the DGBAS, Executive Yuan Order Jiu Pu Guan Tsu No.1050400312A.

EngLawArticles.EngArticleContent: The Standards are enacted in accordance with Article 10 of the Charges and Fees Act.

The standards of collecting fees for census/survey data processing, site and facility usage are as follows:
1.The fees for census/survey data processing derived from specific demand of the users are determined by the volume of data requested, with megabyte as the pricing unit. The fees will be NT$1,000 for less than 50 megabytes of data; NT$2,000 for 50 to less than 100 megabytes of data; NT$4,000 for 100 to less than 500 megabytes of data; and NT$5,000 for 500 megabytes of data and above. The aforementioned fees exclude the saving media, and the data volume is determined separately for each census/survey item.
2.For onsite data processing, the site and facility usage fees apply in addition to the data processing fees in the preceding subparagraph:
(1) The basic fee for site usage of each case will be NT$2,000.
(2) The fees for machine/device usage will be NT$200 per machine/device per day. Less than one day will be counted as one day.

The fees for census/survey data processing, site and facility usage will be exempted according to the following provisions:
1.The fees for census/survey data processing will be reduced by 50% for schools or academic institutions for teaching or research needs.
2.The fees will be fully waived for government agencies or legislative bodies for official business needs.
The Standards take effect on the date of promulgation.
